hypothesis_content.title: Macro News Catalyst as False Regime Transition Trigger
hypothesis_content.statement: A sharp price move (|5-day return| > 10%) triggered by a major macro/regulatory news headline (e.g., key MiCA implementation detail, US ETF decision) that forces an immediate regime classification change (e.g., NEUTRAL → BULL/BEAR) has a >55% probability of being partially or fully reversed within 15 trading days, as the initial overreaction is digested.
hypothesis_content.rationale: Markets often overreact to headline news due to sentiment and positioning squeezes. However, without a concurrent shift in fundamental on-chain metrics or sustained volume, these moves can be fleeting. The current environment of evolving regulation (UK, MiCA) is prone to creating such knee-jerk reactions. A rapid regime shift on news alone is statistically likely to be unstable.
entry_conditions: A major, scheduled macro/regulatory crypto news event occurs (identifiable via news sentiment spike)
The 5-day absolute return following the event is >10%
The FjordHQ regime signal changes within 3 days of the event
The 14-day RSI moves from between 40-60 to above 70 or below 30 within 5 days of the event (overbought/oversold)

exit_conditions.take_profit: Price retraces 50% of the initial 5-day post-news move
exit_conditions.stop_loss: Price extends beyond the initial 5-day post-news move by an additional 5% (momentum continues)
exit_conditions.time_exit: 15 trading days after the regime change signal

hypothesis_content.falsification_criteria: News-induced regime transitions are as likely to persist as to reverse, meaning the initial move correctly anticipates a new, sustained trend driven by the news catalyst's fundamental implications.
